title: Qayyum Stadium
text:
The Qayyum Stadium also known as Peshawar Sport Complex is located in <a href="Peshawar">Peshawar</a>, the capital of <a href="Khyber%20Pakhtunkhwa">Khyber Pakhtunkhwa</a> province in <a href="Pakistan">Pakistan</a>. It is the biggest sports complex in Peshawar and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The sport complex has facilities for all major sports including <a href="Association%20football">football</a>, <a href="field%20hockey">field hockey</a>, <a href="Squash%20%28sport%29">squash</a>, <a href="wrestling">wrestling</a> and <a href="badminton">badminton</a>. The sport complex is owned by <a href="Government%20of%20Khyber%20Pakhtunkhwa">Government of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa</a>. It has total capacity of 30,000 and it is located within walking distance from Peshawar <a href="Saddar%20Bazaar">Saddar</a> and Peshawar Cantonment railway station.
History And Development.
Qayyum Stadium is founded in 1975. The current site was selected in 1975 after previously using several grounds at the different locations in <a href="Peshawar">Peshawar</a>. The current facility is multipurpose sport facility with provision for Football, Field Hockey, Wrestling, Badminton, Karate to name a few.
The first grandstand at the Qayyum Stadium was a cricket club, which was built in 1975. Furthermore, there is another grandstand in football ground. In march 2016, the provincial government of <a href="Pakistan%20Tehreek-e-Insaf">PTI</a> launches the renovation and beautification of Qayyum Stadium. In 2019 it hosted the 33rd <a href="National%20Games%20of%20Pakistan">National Games of Pakistan</a>.
